stories.storyText:
[Code Name] Aak
[Gender] Male
[Combat Experience] None
[Place of Birth] Lungmen
[Date of Birth] Mar 25
[Race] Feline
[Height] 161cm
[Infection Status] 
Confirmed uninfected by medical examination.

[Physical Strength] Normal
[Mobility] Standard
[Physical Resilience] Normal
[Tactical Acumen] Standard
[Combat Skill] Standard
[Originium Arts Assimilation] Standard

A medical personnel from Lee's Detective Agency recommended by Mr. Lee, Aak was a well-known underground doctor operating in the gray zones of Lungmen.
After joining, he proved to be a tremendous wellspring of medical knowledge and theory with the clinical experience to back it up, though his style of practice is rather worrying.
However, based upon Dr. Kal'tsit's comprehensive evaluation, he was recommended on a provisional basis to the medical equipment department and technological development team.

Imaging tests reveal clear, normal outlines of internal organs, and no abnormal shadows have been detected. Originium granules have not been detected in the circulatory system and there are no other signs of infection. At this time, this operator can be confirmed to be uninfected.

[Cell-Originium Assimilation] 0%
Operator Aak shows no signs of Oripathy infection.

[Blood Originium-Crystal Density] 0.11u/L
Operator Aak is incredibly healthy.

I must say, despite everything else here on Rhodes Island, your methods for preventing Oripathy as well as the research that has been conducted are indeed worthy of study.
--Aak

A specialist operator who always wears a hippie-like grin.
Conducts himself with a rather poor, devil-may-care attitude that even spills over to his medical practice, sometimes cracking jokes about his patients' injuries during treatment. However, his medical techniques are indeed unrivaled in the entirety of Rhodes Island.
Usually he'll stay in the small laboratory set aside just for him. The strange smells and unsettling cackling serve as good deterrents to keep people from getting too close.

Though Aak doesn't exactly get along well with other operators, there are three cases that particularly stand out.
The first is Hung. While most people find the ill-natured Aak to be impossible to deal with, Hung is his natural nemesis. If a situation with Aak truly became unbearable, just report it to Hung, and the situation will soon be resolved. While it cannot be said that Aak fears Hung, Hung unabashedly treats Aak like a little brother; and Aak, despite his usual attitude, probably sees Hung as an older sibling as well.
The second is Waai Fu. Though the righteous Waai Fu and the ill-natured Aak would seem totally incompatible, the two have unexpectedly developed a good relationship as members of the same detective agency. Waai Fu believes that Aak is a fundamentally good person, whereas Aak sees Waai Fu as old-fashioned but not impossible to get along with. By the way, if Aak is out looking for trouble, you should call Waai Fu instead of Hung. The ensuing scene is quite entertaining.
The third is Warfarin. After learning that the true identity of 'Mr. Blood' was none other than Warfarin, even Aak, who had spurned mainstream medicine, couldn't help but to engage Warfarin in academic discussions on a frequent basis. Admittedly, Warfarin, whose views towards medicine differ slightly from other medics perhaps as a result of her longevity, and Aak, who is a bit of a freak himself, make an unexpectedly good duo. But as a caveat, when these two find out that they share some common interest and tastes, strange laughing and cheering have become far more prevalent than ever before - either from Warfarin's or Aak's lab, now with two voices instead of one.

Despite the questionable nature of Aak's medical breakthroughs, the discoveries he's made have indeed been amazing.
While his irresponsible attitude has a tendency to make relatively innocuous conditions worse, he is known to tackle rare diseases with his own unique, accurate solutions. Not to mention, he frequently researches and develops medication that seems incomprehensible to the average person, such as pills that make farts smell like watermelon, or make people lose the ability to recognize a certain color.
Of course, if you knew who his father is, this tendency is no longer so puzzling.
Aak's father used to be a well-known attending physician at the Lungmen Central Hospital and was renowned for his medical ethics. But due to a certain incident, he was framed by others for malpractice, after which his career plummeted and he disappeared from the public eye. The next time he reappeared, he had become a vicious illegal doctor in the underworld of Lungmen's black zone, with even Lungmen's gang bosses trembling at his feet. When this person perished a few years ago in a gang war, the entire Lungmen underworld breathed a collective sigh of relief.
Aak clearly inherited his father's mantle, both the good and the bad. Even as a teenager, he made a reputation for himself in the underworld. Without discipline, he perhaps would have walked down the same path as his father, eventually becoming feared as well. However, after meeting Hung, he joined Lee's Detective Agency, a move that can be considered a turning point in his life.

Aak has already surpassed his father, who had fallen victim to being framed. Despite Aak's young age, his views towards medicine have already greatly surpassed that of even experienced doctors who have been immersed within the field for years.
The reason behind this is simple: because he left the mainstream medical circles, he no longer views medicine solely from the perspective of a pure doctor.
Pure doctors will think about problems within the scope of medical practice, preoccupied with how to better save people, often losing sleep or forgetting to eat in the process of developing new drugs. Most of Rhodes Island's medics fall under this category.
However, Aak is different. He saw the limitation of medicine, and recognized that the existence of medicine was due to harm. Of course, a large proportion of this harm occurs naturally in the form of diseases, but because Aak grew up in the black zone, he saw more of the harm that people inflicted upon each other.
Over time, he began to scoff at the idea of pure medicine, resenting his colleagues because they only knew how to save people. They would rush to the scene of a conflict, even the most advanced pharmaceuticals utterly powerless to stop the conflict from having broken out in the first place. The more lofty and prideful the medical profession, the more Aak came to hate it.
Of course, Aak's thoughts are radical and fringe, with his daily behaviors reflecting a bit of his immaturity. Nevertheless, one cannot deny that his ideas are rooted in the bloody reality that shaped his upbringing, and events sometimes unfold in the way he describes. While Rhodes Island does pursue a lofty dream, it also never looks away from reality.
After getting to really know him, several of Rhodes Island's core medic operators set aside their initial disgust towards him and, as his guardian Hung hoped for, decided to show him a better side of this world and provided him with the best possible conditions.
After all, everyone knows that Aak is a genius, and over time, he will surely mature into a phenomenal doctor.

Aak's attitude when he received his second elite promotion - panic, is somewhat surprising. But if you think about it, it's not that hard to understand.
He depreciated all medicine, and within that, saw himself as even lower - 'if medicine is useless, then is it not true that I, as a practitioner of medicine, is even more useless?' The greater his medical proficiency, the more he rejects himself; but if he tries to leave medicine behind, he loses his sense of purpose, and thus the vicious cycle continues.
No one told him that what he was doing was right, no one told him that it was fine to pursue that path, and nobody wanted to give him a place that would accept him. While it must be said that Lee's Detective Agency prevented his sense of morality from going too far astray, his psychological issue had not been resolved. Of course, this is not to place the blame upon the agency, for psychological problems usually require professional help even to be detected. Moreover, a personality like his also requires the proper environment.
And at Rhodes Island, Aak is recognized and accepted for who he is. Everyone tells him that he is just, and reminds him that he is the best at what he does. As for the crux of the reason he resents medicine, Rhodes Island is already addressing the issue - we never intended to rely solely on pharmaceuticals to solve all the world's problems. He either will - or already has - found Rhodes Island to be a suitable place for him, and we will work hard as well to realize his ideals.

skins.description:
An outfit commonly worn by Operators.
While not as practical as a uniform, it's what they find most comfortable.

An outfit that has been improved after the Operator's Promotion.
Custom-made to suit each Operator's experiences and needs, these outfits are designed to provide them maximum flexibility on any battlefield. Furthermore, this is all done without compromising the comfort that they've come to expect.

0011 New Arrivals/Doctor of Faces. Handcrafted by Lungmen artisans, with a design concept more inclined towards the East, its main appeal is to highlight the wearer's personality. Onlookers can sense the simplicities and trends of Lungmen.

0011 New Arrivals/Healing Hand, Evil Heart. Handmade in Lungmen, the outfit includes multiple pieces of clothing that can be mixed and matched based on the customer's mood. The details in the outfit have been adjusted according to his needs, and includes an old-fashioned medicine box.

skills.desc: Attacks an ally within range (prioritizes allies directly in front of this unit) <@ba.vup>15</> times for <@ba.vup>{damage}</> damage, and then increases the Max HP and DEF of self and that unit by <@ba.vup>+{max_hp:0%}</> for the remaining duration of this skill

Attacks an ally within range (prioritizes allies directly in front of this unit) <@ba.vup>15</> times for <@ba.vup>{damage}</> damage, and then increases ATK by <@ba.vup>+{atk:0%}</> and ASPD by <@ba.vup>+{attack_speed}</> of self and that unit for the remaining duration of this skill

candidates.name: Drug Cocktail Administration
candidates.description: Each attack will randomly trigger one of the following effects: Restores own HP by 13%, that attack deals 130% damage, <$ba.sluggish>Slows</> the enemy for 1 second, or <$ba.stun>Stuns</> the enemy for 0.6 seconds

candidates.name: Drug Cocktail Administration
candidates.description: Each attack will randomly trigger one of the following effects: Restores own HP by 14%, that attack deals 140% damage, <$ba.sluggish>Slows</> the enemy for 1.2 seconds, or <$ba.stun>Stuns</> the enemy for 0.8 seconds

candidates.name: Drug Cocktail Administration
candidates.description: Each attack will randomly trigger one of the following effects: Restores own HP by 15%, that attack deals 150% damage, <$ba.sluggish>Slows</> the enemy for 1.4 seconds, or <$ba.stun>Stuns</> the enemy for 1 second

candidates.name: Pharmaceutical Diffusion
candidates.description: Increases healing effects on this unit by 20%

candidates.name: Pharmaceutical Diffusion
candidates.description: Increases healing effects on this unit by 25%<@ba.talpu>(+5%)</>

modules.desc:
Operator Aak has demonstrated a remarkable aptitude for combat via entirely unconventional means.
The Field Operations Department has thus passed the following resolution:
This operator shall be appointed a Specialist Operator during field operations to exercise Geek responsibilities.
In witness whereof,
This badge is hereby conferred upon the above named.

Rain's lifted, but night's just in time to sweep in again. This makes how many times I've slammed the door and left? Hung's some kind of insufferable dude, for real. Keeps dragging me into arguments over 'the meaning of medicine' and 'the right track' and 'having a responsibility.' Like all of that isn't just phony self-servicing junk. The market ain't no peaceful place, but at least it ain't noise that cares about me. Besides, it's not like I'm a stranger to life here. Just reliving the good old days on the lam with the old sleazebag, am I right? 'Thief! C-Catch him!' Man, every day they put on the same dull crap. I'll hand it to the tourist though, a guy with no strength in his right arm stealin' your bag's pretty hilarious. And hopeless. Actually, check that out, I think the thief's a familiar face? That's the poor sucker who came to me for a detox in the middle of the night. He had his whole gang carryin' him around like a swollen eggplant hopped up on growth hormones. Looks like I went a little too easy on him. Man, I knew letting the poison wreck his left arm more would've been a good idea. I've said it before, medicine's not gonna stop harm at the source. If Hung thinks he's so smart... '*sob* Grampa...' Yo, hassle just keeps findin' me. Don't you dare look my way. 'D... Doctor? You have to save my grampa, he's my only family... 'Save how? The old man's practically counting the days. Maybe someone can lay him in a nice sandalwood coffin, give him a decent exit. Either way, that someone ain't me. Think it was a night like this one too, just after the rain lifted. My pops was down for the count after takin' a stray bullet. He dragged me to hide in some street corner he found. Dude hoped I'd take on his mantle. Maybe relieve his pain, or... just straight up address it. The way he went out was kinda ridiculous. Rememberin' how he loved to own the whole unlicensed doctor thing just makes it funnier. '*sob*...' Screw it, I gotta do somethin' to make this kid quit crying so ugly. We'll take watermelon, lychee, and pineapple flavor, mix 'em up, squeeze out the bubbles, aaand... perfect, this med's gonna please the crowd like nothin' else. C'mon, old timer, give your grandkid some peace of mind. Lemme jab you up nice and good. 'Huh? Grampa, are you awake? Grampa? Doctor, why is my grampa laughing so hard...? Grampa, stop laughing, you're gonna make me laugh too...' Hey, a few side-effects comes with the territory. Also, never call me a doctor again, or I'll tell you straight to your face that even if he lasts the night, he— Whatever, at least he can last the night. ...... 'Cooking skills won't stop starvation at the source either. Are you saying that's pointless too?' Weird. How come Hung preaching at me just flashed through my brain? Yeuch, guess I'm gettin' a little peckish, though... Huh? The kitchen lights are still on... dude, Hung, did you not go to bed yet? 'Here, your midnight snack. 'After you're done, wash the dishes, then put them back in the cupboard. They're good habits to learn.' The hell? Here he goes again, educating people without asking.

missionList.desc: During battle, have Aak use Durian-Flavored Stimpack a total of 10 times (excluding Support Units)
Clear Main Theme 2-8 with a 3-star rating; You must deploy your own Aak, and cannot include any Sniper Operators as members

talents.name: Drug Cocktail Administration

voice_lines.voiceText: Oh yeah, my dude, when you're callin' my name to get my attention, don't forget to stress the K at the end. Or else I might assume you're stammering or somethin'.

Whoa, whoa, hold up! Is that vampire lady none other than 'Mr. Blood'?! Man, we've still not settled that medical score we had a while back, and this is the perfect opportunity! I'll have to set up my experiment equipment later... Heheheheh!

Lemme guess, Hung's still tellin' you to watch out around me, ain't he? Oh, just to 'look after me'? Yeah, that sounds like him all right. But listen, Boss, I know your type. You're like me, and you just wanna do whatever you want, right? Then just ignore that guy. We can do whatever fun stuff we like.

Yeah, I develop new drugs, do surgery, and nurture bacteria cultures, but those are all just fun hobbies to me. Doc. Aak? Nah, don't call me that. I don't save anyone, 'cuz I can't teach them the value of their lives. All I can do is just prevent 'em from dying.

The medical department guys are askin' for me? Man, give me a break. I don't dig those professional physicians. They firmly believe that being a doctor's this noble job, and are content with saving more lives... before everything just comes crashing down when their faith got shattered. I've seen that happen time and time again. Honestly, it makes me sad.

I don't dislike Rhodes Island. Instead, I think you guys are doing your job just fine. People are dyin' in the world right as we speak, and with all those doctors cooping up in labs, waiting for patients to knock on their clinics' doors, diseases ain't rid themselves of these lands. Hardly anyone gets it, but you people seem to have it in mind... Keep up the good stuff, will ya?

Me, a cynic? You got me wrong, my dude. I simply pity all the people on this land. Everyone's got their own hardships to deal with, and I know that. But what's the point of curing pains and sufferings when we can't cure their source? What medicine saves a man who's being murdered? Terra doesn't need more doctors in suits, my dude.

My pops was an amazing doctor, and he was all about saving people's lives. But his colleagues slandered him, sidelined him, and framed him. That's how he ended up as a underground doctor, the nastiest among the wicked. Stuff like that ain't so unusual, but I'll admit, what happened to him really changed my own life.

Have Waai Fu and Hung left? Really? Aight, I'm gonna hang out in your office for a while then. Y'know, if anyone can make this land a better place, it's gotta be people like them. You, meanwhile... Well, guess we are simply two peas in a pod, aren't we?
Aha! You Feelin' tired? Then come try this new compound I made! Free of charge, of course!

So you're the Doctor, eh? Nice to meet'cha. My name's Aak. That's right, two A's with a K. Anyway, I'm here 'cause the agency got some business here at Rhodes Island. A quick question before we start: does the phrase 'medical mishap' put you off?
Huh... Does this mean I might get involved in combat scenarios like this? Surely not, right?
A promotion? Almost too good to be true, man. I knew my agency has been exploiting me all along!

Honestly, I dunno if I'm helpful or not. The way I see it, you've gotta be nice to be helpful, and I'm not blind to how people perceive me. But in any case, if you ever get sick, you know who to call.
We goin' on a mission? Sure, let's do it.
All right, team, gimme your thoughts on my new meds after this is done.
Once I start an operation, there's no stoppin' it.
Relax, guys. You just can't die with me by your side.
When prescribing, I always go double-down on the dosage.
I ain't one for battle, but treating peole is so much fun!
Time for a clinical test of my new meds.
Learn to treat yourself with kindness, or regret when sickness treats you.
All lives are equal... while yours is a deviation.
Just take the shot. You will be amazed.
My potion might give the bad guys a new leaf to turn over!
Medicine, a box you wish you've never opened!
I doubt I can make the world a better place on my own, but at least I can stop it from gettin' any worse with your help.
Could we capture some enemies for a little experimenting? It's not violating ethics as long as no one sees it. Not a chance? Aww.
Letting 'em get away like that? You are a saint.
Don't worry, my dude. I can fix any injury as long as the patient's still breathing.
Now, now, let's see. Which of these rooms is my new lab?
Ah?
Yo, my dude! Found any new experiment samples for me?
Arknights.

Happy New Year, my dude. Hung just made a bunch of food, wanna try? I don't really do holidays myself—big rowdy pointless time, when you could be sittin' here takin' the breeze in. But hey, want some tong sui? I got it from the dining table, and man, it's not half bad.
Hey, my dude. What's cookin'?

Heheheh, here's a cake, fruits of my research! I assure you, it's pure cake, nothin' but the same stuff you find in every cake! ...You heard weird laughing from the lab yesterday? My dude, there was no such thing, and I think your ears might be goin' funky. C'mon, a bite of cake'll fix you.

Does it matter that much? I don't really super-mind the kind of man I turn out to be in the end, but it's like Waai Fu and Hung keep having these hopes of somethin'. And Rhodes Island's a little better than what I was thinkin' here. So no duh, I'm happy to keep goin' with you guys.

building_skills.desc: When this Operator is assigned to the Control Center, <@cc.kw>increases</> the likelihood of obtaining Clues <@cc.kw>corresponding to the factions of Operators assigned to the Reception Room</>, but also increases the Morale consumption of Operators assigned to the Control Center by <@cc.vdown>+1.5</>
When this Operator is assigned to be the Trainer in the Training Room, <@cc.kw>Medic</> Operators' Specialization training speed <@cc.vup>+60%</>
